channel.title: Tux Fan Club Docs
channel.description: Recent content on Tux Fan Club Docs

item.title: Connection
item.description: Details about the connection mechanism (how it connects back, retries).

item.title: Persistence
item.description: How the rootkit achieves persistence across reboots.

item.title: Password Protection
item.description: How access to the rootkit is secured.

item.title: Command Execution
item.description: How commands are executed on the victim and results returned.

item.title: File Transfer
item.description: Details on the upload and download functionality.

item.title: Hiding (Cardboard Box)
item.description: Techniques used to hide the rootkit’s presence (files, module listing, syscall hooking).

item.title: Crypto
item.description: Details on the encryption used for communication.

item.title: Bonus Features
item.description: Description of any extra implemented features (upgrade, packet hiding, keylogging, etc.).

item.title: Host Environment
item.description: Details about the required host environment (EPITA Laptop, Ubuntu 24.10).

item.title: Virtualization Software
item.description: Guidance on choosing and installing virtualization software (VirtualBox, QEMU/KVM, etc.).

item.description: Step-by-step guide to create and configure the Attacking Virtual Machine.

item.description: Step-by-step guide to create and configure the Victim Virtual Machine.

item.description: Instructions on how to compile the module (Makefile) and load it into the kernel (insmod/modprobe).

item.title: Configuration Justifications
item.description: Technical explanations for the chosen victim distribution, kernel version, and any security setting modifications.

item.title: Handout Format
item.description: Details on the required file structure, AUTHORS, README, and TODO files.
